body: I have already solved this issue most likely. Please try to use the current version on the master branch instead of the pip package and let me know if you still have the problem. (a v0.1.1 is coming up with this fix included).

I got into same trouble when I ran the following command 
```
ludwig predict --data_csv path/to/sample_dataset.csv --model path/to/results/experiment_run_0/model/
```
later I saw @w4nderlust  comment "**use the current version on the master branch**" , I did it but still same error **KeyError: 'text_char'**

issue.title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'en_core_web_sm' while training a dataset
issue.body:
Getting No module found 'en_core_web_sm' while training dataset

I ran following command
```
ludwig train --data_csv path/to/camera_dataset.csv --model_definition "{input_
features: [{name: Model, type: text}], output_features: [{name: Price, type: numerical}]}"
```

body: Please update to the current master, delete the hdf5 and json files, retrain the model and try again to predict and let me know if the problem is still there.
I updated the Ludwig to current master and as you said removed hdf5 and json files...when I predicted it ...worked like a charm ...got results stored in **result_0**
Glad it worked! @HichemMaiza I'm closing the issuse, feel free to reopen in case following those instructions doesn't solve it for you.

@w4nderlust I am experiencing this same issue, when I run the experiment command when the hfd5 file had already been generated it fails with a KeyError.

If i understood, the way to bypass this issue is by deleting the hdf5 file every single time you train? this adds a lot of overhead since the same dataset needs to be processed every single time.

@manugarri no you don't need to do it, the hdf5 and yaml file exist EXACTLY to avoid preprocessing the dataset every time and removing that overhead.
You need to delete the hdf5 and json file only if you change the feature type in a yaml file and try to use the same dataset, which you shouldn't because the type of the column didn't change really, and if it did  change (meaning you modified the csv file), well then that's a different dataset and you should call it with a different name.

that is weird @w4nderlust , i am not changing the dataset but any time I try to retrain (i stop the experiment after a while for testing) it gives me that error, maybe I should open a new (and properly documented) issue?
@manugarri yes please, if you could provide a reproducible example (csv + yaml) I will gladly look into it. Also make sure you are using the current code from master and not the pip package.
